Water that evaporates moves up into the atmosphere
and forms clouds.The wind that move these clouds
around the globe is called the jet stream.

The movement pattern of the jet stream
changes with seasons.

It brings water patterns, like precipitation
and temperature changes, over different routes
depending on the time of year.

If the jet stream is blocked by what is called a ridge
or a tough of air in the atmosphere, or if it changes
its travel pattern, the weather can change.

So if the jet stream hits a road block,
it might not bring rain for too long a period of time
and drought will occur.

Here's what didn't dry up:
your brand new
